intro: Carpesium triste var. abrotanoides, commonly known as yellow cocklebur, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, spherical seed heads and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and other open areas. It has alternate, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow ray flowers surrounded by tubular florets. The species is often considered a weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
